turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hi, I need help with my bank account. I think I might have been charged twice for a recent transaction.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Hello! I can certainly help with that. To get started, could you please provide the last four digits of your account number and the date and amount of the transaction in question?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Okay, the last four digits are 1234. The transaction was for $50 on October 26th.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Thank you. Please hold one moment while I look into this... Okay, I see one transaction for $50 on October 26th. Can you confirm the merchant name and the exact time of the transactions that you are concerned about?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Ugh, I'm not sure of the exact time. But it was at 'Coffee Corner'. And I'm looking at my statement and it does look like I was charged twice. Why is this so hard?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: I understand your frustration. Unfortunately, I am unable to view transaction times, and for security reasons, it is difficult for me to confirm your specific case. However, if you believe you were charged twice, the best course of action would be to fill out a dispute form which can be found on our website. This will launch an investigation by our fraud department.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Okay, I guess that makes sense. But if the fraud department investigates and finds it's their error, will I get my money back right away or how long does that take?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: That's a great question. The resolution time varies depending on the complexity of the investigation, but generally, you should receive a provisional credit within 10 business days while the investigation is ongoing. Once the investigation is complete, you'll receive a final notification, and the credit will either become permanent or be reversed. Is there anything else I can help you with?
